source.citation: Castro Pérez, S.N. et al. 2020; Zurita Vintimilla, M.C. et al. 2021. HYPRO 775 double-grip processor case studies (Bulletin Transilvania Univ. 13(2); Forests 12:213).
notes: Castro Pérez (2020) provided cycle-element breakdowns and sample-size guidance for a HYPRO 775 working in Ecuadorian pine thinnings (~45 s per cycle, ~4 logs/tree).

Zurita et al. (2021) measured productivity, fuel (21 L/h ≈ 0.78 L/m³), noise, and cardiovascular load for the same HYPRO 775 platform processing small pine at landing (gross 45 trees/h, net 18 trees/h).

scenario.description: HYPRO 775 tractor-mounted double-grip processor working at roadside/landing on small-diameter pine thinning wood.
notes: Average work cycle comprised fast gripping, feeding, cutting events (≈1.5 s per elemental cut).
Operators experienced roughly 85 dB(A) noise exposure; cardio workload averaged about 40 % of max heart rate (classified as heavy work).
Fuel and productivity figures align with Borz et al. (2023) landing-harvester study; adjust utilisation when modelling multi-shift ops.
